id.description: The identifier of a subscription. Will be populated only on successful POST operation

event.description: The event type for which the subscription is made

hookUri.description: The URL where notifications will be sent

CarrierDto.description: This class represents a Carrier in CarrierController. Used for getting data.

entryTypeId.description: The entry type, selected by its identifier.

disableReceipt.description: The basic type of cash transaction designated by this entry type: Receipt or Disbursement.

module.description: The way the entry type is used in the system.

defaultOffsetAccountBranch.description: The branch to which the default offset account belongs.

defaultOffsetAccount.description: The account that is used by default as the offset account for this entry type.

reclasificationAccount.description:
The cash account that is used to temporary hold payments that came to the bank account but cannot be entered as valid payments because the customer or vendor is unknown.
            The parameter is used together with the Use for Payments Reclassification check box.

businessAccount.description:
The vendor account, if the entry type is used to record transactions that involve a particular vendor, or the customer account,
            if the entry type is used to record transactions that involve a particular customer.

description.description: A detailed description of the entry type that is used as transaction description by default.

useForPaymentsReclasification.description: A check box that you select if this entry type is used to record unknown payments that need to be reclassified later.

reclasificationAccountOverride.description: The account that should be used instead of the reclassification account specified as the default one on the Entry Types.

offsetAccountOverride.description:
The account that should be used as the offset account for this entry type with this cash account instead of the default offset account specified on the Entry Types. 
            We recommend that for the disbursement type of transaction, you specify an expense account. For the receipt type of transaction, specify an asset account.

offsetSubaccountOverride.description: The subaccount for this entry type to be used with this cash account instead of the default offset subaccount specified on the Entry Types form.

offsetAccountBranch.description: The branch to which the overriding offset account belongs.

vatZone.description: The tax zone to be used by default with this entry type.

taxCalculationMode.description: The tax calculation mode to be used by default with this entry type

EmployeeDto.description: This class represents an Employee in EmployeeController. Used for getting data.

refNbr.description: The unique reference number of the time card, which Acumatica ERP automatically assigns according to the numbering sequence specified as the Time Card Numbering Sequence on the Time and Expenses Preferences (EP.10.10.00) form.

status.description: The status of the time card

approvalStatus.description: The approval status of the time card

week.description: The week for which the time card has been created.

employee.description: The name of the employee whose time card is currently open.

type.description: The type of the time card. The following options are available:??? Normal: Regular time card??? Correction: Corrective time card, which is a time card that updates a released time card

origRefNbr.description: The reference number of the time card being corrected. This box is filled in only when Correction is specified in the Type box

timeSpent.description: The work hours spent by the employee during the week on activities with the Regular Hours earning type.

invoiceable.description: The invoiceable work hours spent by the employee during the week

overtimeSpent.description: The work hours spent by the employee during the week on activities with the Overtime earning type.

invoiceableOvertime.description: The invoiceable overtime spent by the employee during the week

totalTimeSpent.description: The total working time (regular and overtime) for the week

invoiceableTotalTime.description: The total invoiceable working time (regular and overtime) for the week

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last time the time card line was modified

earningType.description: The type of the work time spent by the employee

project.description: The project that the employee worked on.

mon.description: The work time reported for Monday, including overtime.

tue.description: The work time reported for Tuesday, including overtime.

wed.description: The work time reported for Wednesday, including overtime.

thu.description: The work time reported for Thursday, including overtime.

fri.description: The work time reported for Friday, including overtime.

sat.description: The work time reported for Saturday, including overtime.

sun.description: The work time reported for Sunday, including overtime.

invoiceable.description: A check box that you select to indicate that these work hours are invoiceable.

projectTask.description: The project task that the employee worked on.

timeSpent.description: The work time (regular and overtime) that the employee spent on the project and task during the week.

description.description: The description of the reported work hours.

approvalStatus.description: The approval status, which indicates whether the summary row requires approval and, if it does, what the current state of approval is.

approver.description: The identifier of the person authorized to approve the activity, if approval is required. This is either the approver of the project task or, if no approver is assigned to the project task, the project manager.

approvalStatusText.description: The approval status text suitable for display

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last time the time card line was modified

ExpenseClaimDto.description: This class represents a Expense Claim in ExpenseClaimController. Used for getting data.

refNbr.description: The unique reference number of the expense claim document.

status.description: The current status of the expense claim: On Hold/Pending Approval/Approved/Rejected/Released.

approvalStatus.description: The approval status of the claim

date.description: The date when the claim was entered.

claimedBy.description: The employee who is claiming the expenses. If the claim is released, an Accounts Payable bill will be generated to this employee.

claimTotal.description: The total amount of the claim.

vatTaxableTotal.description: The document total that is subjected to VAT.

vatExemptTotal.description: The document total that is exempt from VAT.

approvalDate.description: The date when the claim was approved.

department.description: The department associated with the expense claim.

location.description: The company location associated with the claim.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The lastest time the expense claim was modified

claimDetailId.description: Identifies the expense claim detail id, necessary when updatind detail information

date.description: The date when the expense was incurred.

expenseItem.description: The expense identifier, if an expense of this type is listed as an inventory nonstock item.

quantity.description: The quantity of this expense item.

uom.description: The unit of measure in which the quantity is shown.

unitCost.description: The cost of a unit of the item.

currency.description: The currency of the expense receipt. However, if you enter a claim line directly, the currency value is read-only and matching the claim currency.

totalAmount.description: The total amount paid for the expense item in the specified quantity.

invoiceable.description: A check box that, if selected, indicates that the claim amount is invoiceable to the customer (the total amount minus the employee's part).

claimAmount.description: The amount claimed by the employee, which is calculated as the total claim amount minus the employee part.

amountInClaimCurr.description: The amount claimed by the employee, which is expressed in the currency of the expense claim.

project.description: The project or customer contract associated with the expense claim, if the work performed was for a project or contract. Project Task The task associated with the contract or project.

projectTask.description: The task associated with the contract or project.

expenseAccount.description: The expense account to which the system should record the part of the expense to be paid back to the employee.

expenseSubaccount.description: The corresponding subaccount the system uses to record the part of the expense to be paid back to the employee.

branch.description: The branch that will reimburse the expenses to the employee.

taxCategory.description: The tax category associated with the expense item.

salesAccount.description: The sales account to which the system should record the part of the amount to charge the customer for. This is applicable only when a customer has been specified.

salesSubaccount.description: The corresponding subaccount the system uses to record the amount to charge the customer for. This is applicable only when a customer has been specified.

employeePart.description: The part of the total amount that will not be paid back to the employee. The percentage depends on the company policy.

customer.description: The identifier of the customer associated with the expense.

location.description: The identifier of the customer location associated with the expense.

arReferenceNbr.description: The reference number of the AR document.

approvalStatus.description: The approval status, which indicates whether the detail row requires approval and, if it does, what the current state of approval is.

approvalStatusText.description: The approval status text suitable for display

approver.description: The identifier of the person authorized to approve the activity, if approval is required. This is either the approver of the project task or, if no approver is assigned to the project task, the project manager.

ExpenseReceiptDto.description: This class represents a Expense Receipt in ExpenseReceiptController. Used by getting data.

date.description: The date when the claim was entered.

claimedBy.description: The employee who is claiming the expenses. If the claim is released, an Accounts Payable bill will be generated to this employee.

customerUpdateAnswer.description: If the customer is updated the claim details customer information can be updated using the provided answer. By default 'SelectedCustomer' is selected.

location.description: The company location associated with the claim.

claimDetailId.description: Identifies the expense claim detail line to update

date.description: The date when the expense was incurred.

expenseItem.description: The expense identifier, if an expense of this type is listed as an inventory nonstock item.

quantity.description: The quantity of this expense item.

uom.description: The unit of measure in which the quantity is shown.

unitCost.description: The cost of a unit of the item.

invoiceable.description: The currency of the expense receipt. However, if you enter a claim line directly, the currency value is read-only and matching the claim currency.

project.description: The project or customer contract associated with the expense claim, if the work performed was for a project or contract. Project Task The task associated with the contract or project.

projectTask.description: The task associated with the contract or project.

expenseAccount.description: The expense account to which the system should record the part of the expense to be paid back to the employee.

expenseSubaccount.description: The corresponding subaccount the system uses to record the part of the expense to be paid back to the employee.

branch.description: The branch that will reimburse the expenses to the employee.

taxCategory.description: The tax category associated with the expense item.

employeePart.description: The part of the total amount that will not be paid back to the employee. The percentage depends on the company policy.

customer.description: The identifier of the customer associated with the expense.

location.description: The identifier of the customer location associated with the expense.

ExpenseReceiptUpdateDto.description: This class represents a Expense Receipt in ExpenseReceiptController. Used to post data to server.

FinancialPeriodDto.description: This class represents a Financial Period in FinancialPeriodController. Used by getting data.

GeneralLedgerBalanceDto.description: This class represents a General Ledger Balance in GeneralLedgerBalanceController. Used by getting data.

financialPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format YYYYMM.

externalCode1.description: ExternalCode1 is deprecated, please use ExternalCode1Info instead.

externalCode2.description: ExternalCode2 is deprecated, please use ExternalCode2Info instead.

inventoryId.description: The unique internal identifier of the  item as is stored in the database

inventoryNumber.description: The unique alphanumeric identifier of the  item that is used in UI

itemClass.description: The item class to which the item is assigned. Selecting a class provides default settings for the item.

postingClass.description: The posting class of the item, which by default is the posting class assigned to the item class.

vatCode.description: The vat category of the item, which by default is the vat category associated with the item class.

defaultPrice.description: The price of the item. This price is used as the default price, if there are no other prices

WarehouseDetailDto.description: This class represents a WarehouseDetail part of InventoryItem in InventoryItemController. Used for getting data.

inventoryNumber.description: Mandatory, The unique alphanumeric identifier of the  item that is used in UI.

itemClass.description: Mandatory, the item class to which the item is assigned. Selecting a class provides default settings for the item.

postingClass.description: The posting class of the item, which by default is the posting class assigned to the item class.

vatCode.description: The vat category of the item, which by default is the vat category associated with the item class.

defaultPrice.description: The price of the item. This price is used as the default price, if there are no other prices set.

InventoryAdjustmentDto.description: This class represents a inventory issue in InventoryIssueController. Used by getting data.

totalCost.description: The total cost of the inventory items received. The system automatically calculates this value as a sum of all extended cost values of all received inventory items listed in the??Transaction Details??tab of this form.

controlCost.description: The total cost of the inventory items to be received.??Control Cost??is available only if the??Validate Document Totals on Entry??option is selected on the??Inventory Preferences??form. The user enters this value manually to confirm the total cost as calculated automatically for the document. If the??Control Cost??and??Total Cost??values do not match, the system generates a warning message and the document cannot be saved.

referenceNumber.description: The unique reference number of the receipt, which the system automatically assigns according to the numbering sequence selected for receipts on the??Inventory Preferences??IN.10.10.00) form.

status.description:
The current status of the receipt. The following options are available: 
            On Hold:The receipt/issue is a draft and can be edited. Receipts with this status cannot be released.
            Balanced: The receipt/issue data has been validated by the system and the receipt can be released. It also can be modified or deleted, but changes can be saved only if the receipt is balanced.
            Released: The receipt/issue has been released and cannot be edited or deleted.

hold.description: A check box that you select to give the receipt the??On Hold??status. Clear the check box to save the receipt with the??Balanced??status.

date.description: The date when the receipt was created. All transactions included in this document will have this transaction date.

postPeriod.description: The financial period to which the transactions recorded in the document should be posted. Format MMYYYY.

externalReference.description: The external reference number of the inventory issue document (for example, the vendor???s reference code).

description.description: A brief description of the inventory issue or its transactions.

totalQuantity.description: The total quantity of inventory items, which the system calculates automatically, for the document.

controlQuantity.description: The manually entered quantity of inventory items.??Control Qty.??is available only if the??Validate Document Totals on Entry??option is selected on the??Inventory Preferences??form. If the??Control Qty.??and??Total Qty.values do not match, the system generates a warning message and the issue cannot be saved.

batchNumber.description: The reference number of the batch generated for the receipt. Click the number to open the??Journal Transactions??(GL.30.10.00) form and view the details of the transactions.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The date when the document was last modified.

attachments.description: The data containing information about the document attachments

controlCost.description: The manually entered summary cost for all specified inventory adjustment items.

referenceNumber.description: The unique reference number of the receipt, which the system automatically assigns according to the numbering sequence selected for receipts on the??Inventory Preferences??IN.10.10.00) form.

hold.description: A check box that you select to give the receipt the??On Hold??status. Clear the check box to save the receipt with the??Balanced??status.

date.description: The date when the receipt was created. All transactions included in this document will have this transaction date.

mon.description: The work time reported for Monday, including overtime.

tue.description: The work time reported for Tuesday, including overtime.

wed.description: The work time reported for Wednesday, including overtime.

thu.description: The work time reported for Thursday, including overtime.

fri.description: The work time reported for Friday, including overtime.

sat.description: The work time reported for Saturday, including overtime.

sun.description: The work time reported for Sunday, including overtime.

invoiceable.description: A check box that you select to indicate that these work hours are invoiceable.

description.description: The description of the reported work hours.
